tool.name: PTPredict
tool.description: predicts the likelihood of peptides to be proteotypic via svm_model which is trained by PTModel
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && mkdir svm_model && ln -s '$svm_model' 'svm_model/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $svm_model.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($svm_model.ext)' &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && export PYTHONPATH='$__tool_directory__/CTDopts/' && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' -svm_model 'svm_model/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $svm_model.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($svm_model.ext)'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: svm_model
param.label: svm model in libsvm format (can be produced by PTModel)

param.name: max_number_of_peptides
param.label: the maximum number of peptides considered at once (bigger number will lead to faster results but needs more memory)

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

tool.help:
predicts the likelihood of peptides to be proteotypic via svm_model which is trained by PTModel
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_PTPredict.html
